## Enumerations

### enum  {#aa9c705ecec80ebd584bb3d54b48f7ee1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum MaskedICmpType ">
Classify (icmp eq (A &amp; B), C) and (icmp ne (A &amp; B), C) as matching patterns that can be simplified.

 (=    64)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

One of A and B is considered the mask. The other is the value. This is described as the &quot;AMask&quot; or &quot;BMask&quot; part of the enum. If the enum contains only &quot;Mask&quot;, then both A and B can be considered masks. If A is the mask, then it was proven that (A &amp; C) == C. This is trivial if C == A or C == 0. If both A and C are constants, this proof is also easy. For the following explanations, we assume that A is the mask.

&quot;AllOnes&quot; declares that the comparison is true only if (A &amp; B) == A or all bits of A are set in B. Example: (icmp eq (A &amp; 3), 3) -&gt; AMask&#95;AllOnes

&quot;AllZeros&quot; declares that the comparison is true only if (A &amp; B) == 0 or all bits of A are cleared in B. Example: (icmp eq (A &amp; 3), 0) -&gt; Mask&#95;AllZeroes

&quot;Mixed&quot; declares that (A &amp; B) == C and C might or might not contain any number of one bits and zero bits. Example: (icmp eq (A &amp; 3), 1) -&gt; AMask&#95;Mixed

&quot;Not&quot; means that in above descriptions &quot;==&quot; should be replaced by &quot;!=&quot;. Example: (icmp ne (A &amp; 3), 3) -&gt; AMask&#95;NotAllOnes

If the mask A contains a single bit, then the following is equivalent: (icmp eq (A &amp; B), A) equals (icmp ne (A &amp; B), 0) (icmp ne (A &amp; B), A) equals (icmp eq (A &amp; B), 0)

Try to fold ((icmp X u&lt; P) &amp; (icmp(X &amp; M) != M)) or ((icmp X s&gt; -1) &amp; (icmp(X &amp; M) != M)) into (icmp X u&lt; M).

Where P is a power of 2, M &lt; P, and M is a contiguous shifted mask starting at the right most significant zero bit in P. SGT is supported as when P is the largest representable power of 2, an earlier optimization converts the expression into (icmp X s&gt; -1). Parameter P supports masking using undef/poison in either scalar or vector values.

### foldSignedTruncationCheck() {#a1f569ebf4402ad560d7c147f688ac05a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Value &#42; foldSignedTruncationCheck (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42; ICmp0, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42; ICmp1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; CxtI, InstCombiner::BuilderTy &amp; Builder)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
General pattern: X &amp; Y.

Where Y is checking that all the high bits (covered by a mask 4294967168) are uniform, i.e. arg &amp; 4294967168 can be either 4294967168 or 0 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pattern">Pattern</a> can be one of: t = add i32 arg, 128 r = icmp ult i32 t, 256 Or t0 = shl i32 arg, 24 t1 = ashr i32 t0, 24 r = icmp eq i32 t1, arg Or t0 = trunc i32 arg to i8 t1 = sext i8 t0 to i32 r = icmp eq i32 t1, arg This pattern is a signed truncation check.

And X is checking that some bit in that same mask is zero. I.e. can be one of: r = icmp sgt i32 arg, -1 Or t = and i32 arg, 2147483648 r = icmp eq i32 t, 0

Since we are checking that all the bits in that mask are the same, and a particular bit is zero, what we are really checking is that all the masked bits are zero. So this should be transformed to: r = icmp ult i32 arg, 128

If we have a masked merge, in the canonical form of: (assuming that A only has one use.) | A | |B| ((x ^ y) &amp; M) ^ y | D |.

<ul>
<li>If M is inverted: | D | ((x ^ y) &amp; ~M) ^ y We can canonicalize by swapping the final xor operand to eliminate the &#39;not&#39; of the mask. ((x ^ y) &amp; M) ^ x</li>
<li>If M is a constant, and D has one use, we transform to &#39;and&#39; / &#39;or&#39; ops because that shortens the dependency chain and improves analysis: (x &amp; M) | (y &amp; ~M)</li>
</ul>

<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Classify (icmp eq (A &amp; B), C) and (icmp ne (A &amp; B), C) as matching patterns</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// One of A and B is considered the mask. The other is the value. This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// described as the &quot;AMask&quot; or &quot;BMask&quot; part of the enum. If the enum contains</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// only &quot;Mask&quot;, then both A and B can be considered masks. If A is the mask,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// then it was proven that (A &amp; C) == C. This is trivial if C == A or C == 0</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For the following explanations, we assume that A is the mask.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;AllOnes&quot; declares that the comparison is true only if (A &amp; B) == A or all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bits of A are set in B.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Example: (icmp eq (A &amp; 3), 3) -&gt; AMask&#95;AllOnes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;AllZeros&quot; declares that the comparison is true only if (A &amp; B) == 0 or all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bits of A are cleared in B.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Example: (icmp eq (A &amp; 3), 0) -&gt; Mask&#95;AllZeroes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;Mixed&quot; declares that (A &amp; B) == C and C might or might not contain any</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Example: (icmp eq (A &amp; 3), 1) -&gt; AMask&#95;Mixed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;Not&quot; means that in above descriptions &quot;==&quot; should be replaced by &quot;!=&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Example: (icmp ne (A &amp; 3), 3) -&gt; AMask&#95;NotAllOnes</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// General pattern:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   X &amp; Y</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Where Y is checking that all the high bits (covered by a mask 4294967168)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are uniform, i.e.  %arg &amp; 4294967168  can be either  4294967168  or  0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Pattern can be one of:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %t = add        i32 %arg,    128</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %r = icmp   ult i32 %t,      256</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %t0 = shl       i32 %arg,    24</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %t1 = ashr      i32 %t0,     24</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %r  = icmp  eq  i32 %t1,     %arg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %t0 = trunc     i32 %arg  to i8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %t1 = sext      i8  %t0   to i32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %r  = icmp  eq  i32 %t1,     %arg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This pattern is a signed truncation check.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// And X is checking that some bit in that same mask is zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// I.e. can be one of:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %r = icmp sgt i32   %arg,    -1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %t = and      i32   %arg,    2147483648</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %r = icmp eq  i32   %t,      0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Since we are checking that all the bits in that mask are the same,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and a particular bit is zero, what we are really checking is that all the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// masked bits are zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// So this should be transformed to:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   %r = icmp ult i32 %arg, 128</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835" lineLink="#a1f569ebf4402ad560d7c147f688ac05a"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="#a1f569ebf4402ad560d7c147f688ac05a">foldSignedTruncationCheck</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42;ICmp0, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42;ICmp1,</span></CodeLine>
